tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditionally Exempt / 40th qualifier from Qualifying Tournament, Money List 61-100
tourBios.carHigh: Has also played on the Tear Drop Tour (1999-2000) and the Hooters Tour (2001-05). 2011: Made the cut in nine of 22 starts on the Web.com Tour. Was T10 at the season-opening Panama Claro Championship. Also finished T11 at The Rex Hospital Open in Raleigh, where he was born...Qualified for the U.S. Open at Congressional CC but missed the cut. 2010: Opened the season with a T10 finish at the Panama Claro Championship, his career-best on the Web.com Tour, topping a T11 at the 2004 Chattanooga Classic. 2006: Played his rookie season on the Web.com Tour, missing the cut in all 13 starts. 2004: Enjoyed a T11 at the Chattanooga Classic...Won the Hooters Tour Tour Championship, which helped him become the Tour's leading money-winner that year. Also captured one victory on the Tear Drop Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: A member of the 1997-1998 ACC Championship team.
tourBios.personal: Got his start in golf from his dadâwho he lists as his heroâat age 8. His dad, Sam, played golf and basketball at North Carolina State, lettering in 1965 and 1966. Both parents and his brother are graduates of North Carolina State, with his mom eventually earning a master's degree from Duke University. Brother is a teacher in Thailand...Cites winning the 2004 Hooters Tour Championship and making it to the final stage of the 2005 and 2006 PGA TOUR National Qualifying Tournament as his biggest thrills in golf. Played high school basketball with former NBA player Bobby Jackson...Bucket list includes playing in all four majors...Won three times on eGolf Tour, including the 2004 Tour Championship...Was the head Instructor at the Mike Bender Elite Golf Academy in Incheon, South Korea, in 2009. Head instructor at the Mike Bender Golf Academy in Lake Mary, Fla., in 2010.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T10th in 2011 at the Panama CLARO Championship.
